item.title: EAM1 - Aircraft Design, Structures and Aerospace Systems
item.description:
Overview

The EAM1 area focuses on aircraft design, aerospace structures, and aerospace systems, providing comprehensive training in aerodynamics, aeroelasticity, and multidisciplinary optimization.

Research Areas

Aerodynamics, Aeroelasticity and Aeroacoustics

  • Computational fluid dynamics
  • Wind tunnel testing
  • Aeroelastic analysis
  • Noise prediction and control

Aerospace Systems

  • Satellite systems design
  • Space mission planning
  • Orbital mechanics
  • Spacecraft subsystems

Flight Mechanics and Control

  • Aircraft performance analysis
  • Flight control systems
  • Autopilot design
  • Stability and control

Advanced Composites and Aerospace Structures

  • Composite material design
  • Structural analysis
  • Fatigue and damage tolerance
  • Lightweight structures

Integrated Aircraft Design and Multidisciplinary Optimization (MDO)

  • Conceptual design methods
  • Optimization algorithms
  • Design space exploration
  • Trade-off studies

Representative

Professor: Flávio Luiz Cardoso Ribeiro

item.title: EAM2 - Aerospace Propulsion and Energy
item.description:
Overview

The EAM2 area specializes in aerospace propulsion systems and energy technologies, covering combustion, thermal systems, and renewable energy applications.

Research Areas

Combustion and Propulsion of Aircraft and Aerospace Vehicles

  • Rocket engine design
  • Gas turbine engines
  • Combustion modeling
  • Propulsion system integration

Gas Turbine Design and Technology

  • Turbine blade cooling
  • Compressor design
  • Engine performance analysis
  • Emissions reduction

Thermal Systems Analysis and Fluid Mechanics

  • Heat transfer modeling
  • Fluid flow analysis
  • Thermal management
  • Energy systems optimization

Renewable Energy

  • Solar thermal systems
  • Photovoltaic technology
  • Wind energy systems
  • Biomass energy

Conventional Energy

  • Oil and natural gas systems
  • Energy conversion
  • Storage technologies
  • Grid integration

Fuel Cells and Hydrogen

  • PEM fuel cells
  • Solid oxide fuel cells
  • Hydrogen production
  • Hydrogen storage systems

Refrigeration and Air Conditioning

  • Cryogenic systems
  • HVAC design
  • Energy efficiency
  • Environmental impact

Heat Exchangers

  • Design optimization
  • Performance analysis
  • Compact heat exchangers
  • Two-phase flow

Representative

Professor: Izabela Batista Henriques

item.title: EAM3 - Materials, Manufacturing and Automation
item.description:
Overview

The EAM3 area encompasses materials science, manufacturing processes, and automation technologies, focusing on advanced materials and Industry 4.0 applications.

Research Areas

Materials Science

  • Metallic materials
  • Ceramic materials
  • Polymer composites
  • Nanomaterials

Manufacturing Processes

  • Machining processes
  • Casting and molding
  • Welding technologies
  • Surface engineering

Materials Processing and Characterization

  • Heat treatment
  • Microstructural analysis
  • Mechanical testing
  • Non-destructive testing

Advanced Materials

  • Smart materials
  • Bio-materials
  • Aerospace materials
  • High-performance alloys

Mechatronics

  • Control systems
  • Sensors and actuators
  • Embedded systems
  • Robotics

Industrial Automation

  • PLC programming
  • SCADA systems
  • Process control
  • Quality control

Advanced Manufacturing and Industry 4.0

  • Additive manufacturing
  • Digital manufacturing
  • IoT in manufacturing
  • Artificial intelligence applications

Representative

Professor: Rene F. B. Gonçalves
